Today, Chair DeFazio will continue to do everything he can to ensure safety for crew and passengers.

After the Colgan Air flight 307 in 2009 prompted investigations into pilot fatigue, Chair DeFazio cosponsored a bill that increased airline pilot licensing requirements for regional and mainline airline pilots.
In the 2000 FAA reauthorization bill, he secured approval of a provision to require the permanent marking of all used airline parts so they cannot be reinstalled in airplanes.
After the ValuJet Flight 592 crash in 1996, Chair DeFazio fought to strip the FAA of its mandate to promote the aviation industry.

When it comes to aviation safety, Chair DeFazio has always been an advocate for ensuring that our aviation system remains the safest in the world. After 55 people died during the evacuation of British Airtours flight 28M, he fought for years to improve exit rows on planes.

It‚Äôs not just accidental shootings. Over 75 percent of school shootings involve kids and teens having access to unsecured or unsupervised guns at home. And more than 80 percent of guns used by youth in suicide attempts were kept in the home of the victim, a relative, or a friend.

The #PreventFamilyFire Act provides a modest tax credit to incentivize the sale of things like gun safes. If we expand safe storage, we can reduce accidental shootings by 73 percent. It‚Äôs that simple.

Every single day, eight kids are killed or injured by unintentional shootings with guns found in the home. We can prevent that by expanding safe storage of firearms. Today, I‚Äôm introducing a bipartisan bill to do just that. #PreventFamilyFire https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/30/politics/gun-violence-prevention-bill-safe-firearm-storage/index.html
